findings.title: Token balances validation
findings.description: The swap method expects fromToken and toToken balances to be zero, which negatively affects the security of the smart contract.

findings.title: Claim stuck and spam tokens
findings.description: It is assumed the contract does not have any tokens before and after a swap. In any case, it is useful to have a special method that allows retrieving stuck tokens.

findings.title: fromToken is not equal to toToken check
findings.description: The logic underlying the swap method checks that fromToken != toToken . However, the swap method itself is a better place for that kind of require.

findings.title: Redundant goodSwap method
findings.description: The goodSwap method is a combination of the getExpectedReturn and swap methods. Since getExpectedReturn is supposed to be called from the DApp frontend rather than from a smart contract, it can be confusing for developers who utilize OneSplit.
